gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6.b Support and strengthen the participation of the local population in improving water and sanitation management
6.b.1.Proportion of local governments that have operational policies and procedures in place that encourage the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management
REGIDESO
WAKANA Ferdinand
MHEM statistics and planning department
SDG focal point at MHEM
1156 BUJUMBURA
wakanafer@yahoo.fr

Workforce of local administrations with policies and operational procedures in place encouraging the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management in relation to the total workforce
Percentage
Administrative data
Data is collected daily from the MHEM
every year
annually
MHEM / REGIDESO
The MHEM statistical service is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation of this indicator at the national level.
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

The indicator is relevant because it reports on the level of adherence of local administrations to operational policies and procedures encouraging the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management
The increase in this proportion will be conditioned by an increased awareness of local administrations

Workforce of local administrations that have policies and operational procedures in place to encourage the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management in relation to the total workforce
Administrative data are validated by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Annual report of the Ministry of Hydraulics, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO and AHAMR)
